HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]
